question: A gas is taken from state A to state B along two different paths 1 and 2. The heat absorbed and work done by the system along these two paths are <katex>$Q_1$</katex> and <katex>$Q_2$</katex> and <katex>$W_1$</katex> and <katex>$W_2$</katex> respectively. Then
explanation: The change in internal energy <katex>$\Delta U$</katex> depends only on the initial and final states, not the path.
According to the First Law of Thermodynamics: <katex>$\Delta U = Q - W$</katex>.
Since states A and B are fixed, <katex>$\Delta U_1 = \Delta U_2$</katex>.
